name: Bear with me...
description: From lovable anthropomorphic bears to hyperreal grizzlies, explore connections between cartoon and CGI bears across screen culture.

key_work.title: Humphrey B Bear
key_work.credit_line:
Plush toy (1976) and Hand puppet (1977), Classic Toys Pty Ltd. ACMI Collection. Donated by Daniel Clem, 2022

The Adventures of Humphrey Bear (1974), Gordon A. Rule, published by Rigby Ltd

Vinyl LP (1972), Jigsaw puzzle (1983), Mug & bowl (c.1983), Puzzle clock (1983), Bath book (1989), Southern Television Corp. Pty Ltd

Black and white publicity stills (1980s, ACMI Collection), Plaster moulding set (1991), Humphrey in the Snow VHS (1994, ACMI Collection, Banksia Productions
key_work.brief_description: The fun-loving Humphrey B Bear first bounded onto Australian TV in 1965 and has been bringing joy to children and adults ever since. Humphrey was the star of the Here’s Humphrey show, one of the world’s longest-running kids’ TV shows with around 3,000 episodes. Humphrey‚Äôs popularity is evident in all this merchandise and memorabilia. From plush toys and vinyl records to bath books and plaster sets, Humphrey has inspired children across decades to play, learn and create at home.

end.brief_description: In the 1820s, a frontiersman, Hugh Glass, sets out on a path of vengeance against those who left him for dead after a bear mauling.

constellations_other.name: Fish-eyes and fun times
constellations_other.description: This Constellation starts with The Favourite and ends up at Rambo, and was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

constellations_other.name: Bear with me...
constellations_other.description: From lovable anthropomorphic bears to hyperreal grizzlies, explore connections between cartoon and CGI bears across screen culture.

links.description: The extreme and gruesome bear fight sequences in Love, Death & Robots(2019) episode ‘Kill Team Kill’ are reminiscent of the pivotal bear attack scene in The Revenant (2015), which also relied on CGI to realistically create the mother bear that mauls Hugh Glass (Leonardo DiCaprio).

start.title: Kung Fu Panda 2
start.creator_credit: Jennifer Yuh Nelson, Glenn Berger, Jonathan Aibel, Clare Knight, Maryann Brandon, Melissa Cobb, DreamWorks Animation and Raymond Zibach
start.brief_description: Po is now living his dream as The Dragon Warrior, protecting the Valley of Peace alongside his friends and fellow kung fu masters, The Furious Five - Tigress, Crane, Mantis, Viper and Monkey. But Po‚Äôs new life of awesomeness is threatened by the emergence of a formidable villain, who plans to use a secret, unstoppable weapon to conquer China and destroy kung fu. It is up to Po and The Furious Five to journey across China to face this threat and vanquish it. But how can Po stop a weapon that can stop kung fu? He must look to his past and uncover the secrets of his mysterious origins; only then will he be able to unlock the strength he needs to succeed.

links.description: Jennifer Yuh Nelson made her feature-length directorial debut with Kung Fu Panda 2 and later went onto direct the Love, Death & Robots (2019) episode ‘Kill Team Kill’, which featured a cybernetically enhanced grizzly bear fighting US Special Forces operatives.

start.title: Banjo-Kazooie
start.brief_description: In this 3D platformer, the heroic but naive bear Banjo enlists his cowardly bird buddy Kazooie to help rescue his younger sister from a vain, beauty-stealing witch. The player is tasked with exploring the witch’s lair and the nine large, open levels within it, looking for tasks and challenges to complete. Along the way they meet a variety of characters who teach them new moves and transform them into different animals. Modeled after Super Mario 64, Banjo-Kazooie is distinguished by its cheeky and sarcastic sense of humor and by a large, varied, and novel moveset.

But Po‚Äôs new life of awesomeness is threatened by the emergence of a formidable villain, who plans to use a secret, unstoppable weapon to conquer China and destroy kung fu. It is up to Po and The Furious Five to journey across China to face this threat and vanquish it. But how can Po stop a weapon that can stop kung fu? He must look to his past and uncover the secrets of his mysterious origins; only then will he be able to unlock the strength he needs to succeed.

constellations_other.name: Bear with me...

links.description: Banjo is one part of the bear-bird fighting duo Banjo-Kazooie, who rely on combined attack moves to save Banjo‚Äôs sister Tooty. Similarly, Po the Panda Bear fights alongside the Furious Five to protect the Valley of Peace in Kung Fu Panda 2 (2011).

start.title: Hooked Bear
start.creator_credit: Jack Hannah, Walt Disney, Walt Disney Productions, Al Bertino and David Detiege
start.brief_description: Humphrey the bear isn’t having much luck with his fishing; every time he catches some nice fish, he gets distracted and drops them. So he goes after the catches of the local anglers instead. But ranger Woodlore frowns on this, insisting the bear fish like one.

constellations_other.name: Bear with me...
constellations_other.description: From lovable anthropomorphic bears to hyperreal grizzlies, explore connections between cartoon and CGI bears across screen culture.

end.title: Banjo-Kazooie
end.brief_description: In this 3D platformer, the heroic but naive bear Banjo enlists his cowardly bird buddy Kazooie to help rescue his younger sister from a vain, beauty-stealing witch. The player is tasked with exploring the witch’s lair and the nine large, open levels within it, looking for tasks and challenges to complete. Along the way they meet a variety of characters who teach them new moves and transform them into different animals. Modeled after Super Mario 64, Banjo-Kazooie is distinguished by its cheeky and sarcastic sense of humor and by a large, varied, and novel moveset.

constellations_other.name: Bear with me...
constellations_other.description: From lovable anthropomorphic bears to hyperreal grizzlies, explore connections between cartoon and CGI bears across screen culture.

links.description: Like Humphrey the Bear, Banjo the bear from the single-player videogame Banjo-Kazooie (1998) makes vocal sounds to convey dialogue and emotions instead of speaking. Banjo and other characters’ voices are subtitled to make the videogame available in multiple languages.

start.title: Here's Humphrey
start.brief_description: Here’s Humphrey is an Australian children’s television series first aired on Monday 24 May 1965 on the Nine Network. It featured a character known as Humphrey B. Bear. In the early days Humphrey was known as Bear Bear and was named Humphrey B. Bear as the result of an on-air competition. Here’s Humphrey has become one of the most successful programs for pre-schoolers in Australia.

constellations_other.name: Bear with me...
constellations_other.description: From lovable anthropomorphic bears to hyperreal grizzlies, explore connections between cartoon and CGI bears across screen culture.

end.creator_credit: Jack Hannah, Walt Disney, Walt Disney Productions, Al Bertino and David Detiege
end.brief_description: Humphrey the bear isn’t having much luck with his fishing; every time he catches some nice fish, he gets distracted and drops them. So he goes after the catches of the local anglers instead. But ranger Woodlore frowns on this, insisting the bear fish like one.

constellations_other.name: Bear with me...
constellations_other.description: From lovable anthropomorphic bears to hyperreal grizzlies, explore connections between cartoon and CGI bears across screen culture.

links.description: Australian icon Humphrey B. Bear has a Disney counterpart, Humphrey the Bear, who was the main character in the short film Hooked Bear (1956) and has made several appearances throughout Disney films and TV episodes.
